Records, 1959-1967
titlepage.author:
Finding aid created by
Thomas Powers, 1984

did.abstract: Central committee and subcommittee minutes; files relating to major ceremonies, the sesquicentennial award, and the participation of the different University schools and units in the celebration; invitations; topical files; photographs; and audio-tapes of the major ceremonies.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

did.physloc: Portions located in offsite storage; prior notification required for access.

acqinfo.p: The manuscript records (Donor No. 4564) were deposited by various University units, 1968-1970. The photographs were deposited by the University of Michigan Press (Donor No. 2546), 1975.

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research, except for negatives in box 14, which are restricted to staff use only.

userestrict.p: Copy right is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan. Selected photographs published in The University, copyright University of Michigan, 1967

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Michigan University Sesquicentennial Office Records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Office established to administer and coordinate celebratory events during the University of Michigan's sesquicentennial anniversary year.

scopecontent.p: The records of the Sesquicentennial Committee include administrative files (mainly correspondence and minutes) documenting the activities of the committee as a whole and subcommittees related to each of the major ceremonies of the sesquicentennial celebration; audiotapes of major ceremonies; and photographs.

did.unittitle: Programs of University of Michigan schools, departments, colleges
[Sesquicentennial Materials taken from Files of the Vice President for Academic Affairs]
Includes drafts of programs, general correspondence, and clippings
Photographs: Sesquicentennial events and office staff. Phil Davis Sesquicentennial Exhibition

scopecontent.p: The major portion of this series contains negatives and contact prints of about 8000 photographs taken primarily by Phil Davis, professor of art at the University of Michigan. (Some of the photos were taken by Terry Sam, Gottfried Hogh, David Cornwell, and Guy Palazzola.)

The photographs were taken in preparation for a 1967 exhibition, part of the University's sesquicentennial celebration. 264 photos were selected from the collection to be part of the exhibition, which was mounted outdoors on the wall between Hill Auditorium and the Michigan League. Later 141 photos selected from those exhibited were published as The University, published by the University of Michigan Press (call number FImu/E17/outsize).

The exhibition photos were selected to follow the life of a University of Michigan student from registration to graduation, but the complete series documents a much broader range of university activities during the mid-1960s, including classroom, study, and leisure activities of students; faculty teaching and research; administrators and regents; buildings and other campus scenes; musical, theater, and athletic events; and off-campus activities such as research shops, Interlochen, Shady Trails Camp, and forestry and geology camps.

The series is arranged by contact print sheet number. The contact sheets are 35mm prints unless otherwise noted. The entry for each contact sheet includes the contact sheet number, a description of the content/subject of the images, possibly a note on the size of film or camera used, and the number of frames on the sheet.

A card index to subjects photographed is located with other photographic collection card indexes. (See the reference archivist for access to this index.) Appendix II to this inventory contains a list of the subject headings used in the card index.

The copy of The University found in the Michigan Historical Collections printed collection (call number FImu/E17/outsize) has been annotated with the sheet number of each image used. For each photo used in the book, this series contains a number of other shots of the same subject.
The Exhibition series also includes 1 folder of photos of Davis preparing his exhibition, 1 folder of views of the exhibition, and 1 folder listing the photos used in the exhibition with captions.
